content: प्रणयः {@--1@} Espousing, seizing (as in marriage); <ls>Māl. 6. 14.</ls> {@--2@} ({%a%}) Love, affection, fondness, attachment, liking, regard; साधारणोयमुभयोः प्रणयः स्मरस्य <ls>V. 2. 16</ls>; साधारणोयं प्रणयः <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; (where in both cases sense 6 may do as well); <ls>Ś. 6. 7</ls>; <ls n="Ś.">5. 23</ls>; <ls>Me. 105</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 12</ls>; <ls>Bh. 2. 42.</ls> ({%b%}) A wish, desire, longing; <ls>Ku. 5. 85</ls>; <ls>Māl. 8. 7</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 16.</ls> {@--3@} Friendly acquaintance or regard, friendship, intimacy; <ls>Māl. 1. 9.</ls> {@--4@} Familiarity, confidence, trust; मया गृहीते सलिलेऽ नेन कृतः प्रणयः <ls>Ś. 5.</ls> {@--5@} Favour, kindness, act of courtesy; अलंकृतोऽस्मि स्वयंग्राहप्रणयेन भवता <ls>Mk. 1</ls>; <ls n="Mk.">1. 45.</ls> {@--6@} An entreaty, request, solicitation; तद्भतताथानुग नार्हसि त्वं संबंधिनो मे प्रणयं विहंतु <ls>R. 2. 28</ls>; <ls>V. 4. 13.</ls> {@--7@} Reverence, obeisance. {@--8@} Final beatitude. {@--9@} A leader. {@--10@} Conduct, guidance. (प्रणयेन confidentially, candidly; without reserve or ceremony; प्रणयात् openly, frankly).
